skill.name: distributed-tracing
skill.description: Implement distributed tracing with Jaeger and Tempo to track requests across microservices and identify performance bottlenecks. Use when debugging microservices, analyzing request flows, or implementing observability for distributed systems.
skill.summary: Implement distributed tracing with Jaeger and Tempo to track requests across microservices and ident...

security_audit.summary: The skill is documentation-only and contains no executable code or hidden tool calls. No data access, network exfiltration, or persistence patterns are present.

content.value_statement: You need to see request paths and latency across services. This skill provides clear Jaeger, Tempo, and OpenTelemetry setup guidance.
actual_capabilities: Explain trace, span, and context concepts with examples
Provide Jaeger deployment guidance for Kubernetes and Docker Compose
Show OpenTelemetry instrumentation patterns in Python, Node.js, and Go
Describe trace context propagation headers and client usage
Outline sampling strategies and troubleshooting checks
limitations: Does not execute deployments or run commands
Does not cover tracing vendors beyond Jaeger and Tempo
Does not include production security hardening steps
Does not generate or validate code automatically

use_cases.title: Cluster tracing rollout
use_cases.description: Plan Jaeger or Tempo setup and sampling settings for a Kubernetes environment.

use_cases.title: Service instrumentation
use_cases.description: Add OpenTelemetry tracing to Python, Node.js, or Go services.

use_cases.title: Latency investigation
use_cases.description: Analyze trace paths and identify slow spans and error propagation.

prompt_templates.title: Start tracing basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain trace, span, and context with a simple microservices example.

prompt_templates.title: Jaeger quick setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a Docker Compose setup for Jaeger and the main ports I should expose.

prompt_templates.title: Instrument a service
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to instrument a Flask service with OpenTelemetry and send traces to Jaeger.

prompt_templates.title: Sampling strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a sampling strategy for production and explain tradeoffs.

output_examples.input: How do I troubleshoot missing traces in Jaeger?
output: Verify exporter configuration in the app
Confirm sampling rate is not zero
Review application logs for exporter errors

best_practices: Use consistent span naming and service identifiers
Propagate trace context across every service boundary
Tune sampling rates to balance cost and visibility
anti_patterns: Sampling everything in production without cost review
Mixing inconsistent service names across services

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides vendor-neutral guidance that works in all three platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It is documentation-only and does not execute commands or deploy infrastructure.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing observability stack?
faq.answer: Yes, it describes OpenTelemetry concepts that can be adapted to most stacks.

faq.question: Does it access or send my data?
faq.answer: No. The skill content contains no data access or network actions.

faq.question: What if traces do not appear?
faq.answer: Check endpoints, network connectivity, sampling settings, and application logs.

faq.question: How does it compare to APM vendor guides?
faq.answer: It is a concise, open-source focused guide without vendor-specific tooling.
